avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow will subside and melt in thaw and rain night to Friday. Bcmg colder and snow will strengthen. SW wind and snowshowers and small windslabs can form.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Dominating SW winds and showers of snow the last week however much of the snow has drifted from the area. Thawing with rain to mountaintops night to Friday and snow is expected to subside and melt, becoming colder on Friday and snow expected to sterengthen. Snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll 30th of Jan in NW facing aspect. The profile showed layers of hard windslabs with layers of hail in between. Extended stability test gave fracture at high stress, (ECTN26 @80cm). Smaller windslabs can form in SW wind until Sunday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV eða V með éljum og kólnandi veðri, snýst í NA eða breytilega átt á sunnudag og dregur úr úrkomu.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalnches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð evening of 30th of Jan and night to 1st of Feb. Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable windslabs possible in all aspects. Dry snow in mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. Now there is considerable new snow in the area. Snowprofile taken 30th of Jan in Seljalandsdalur showed layered windslabs with a hard thin layer between them on top of melt/freeze snow. Compression test gave straight fracture by medium stress in the new windslabs (CT13/15@56cm).

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV átt og él, kólnandi veður. Snýst í NA átt og él á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are on N-E aspects after strong SW winds. Snowfall on Friday but rain at lower elevations which could cause wet avalanches. Snowfall on Saturday during northeasterly winds with possible windslab formations on southwesterly aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs and cornices are present, especially on N-E aspects after SW winds. Weak layers could be present. It will snow the night before Friday but rain at lower elevations which could cause wet avalanches. Snowfall on Saturday during NE-winds and possible drifting snow, which could cause windslab formation on SW-aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt föstudags snjóar í fremur hægum vindi en kólnar og snýst fljótt í hvassa SV/V-átt með éljum og skafrenningi. Á laugardag snýst í  norðaustlæga átt með snjókomu og skafrenningi. Útlit fyrir hægari vind á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður last weekend. A small wet sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: It will snow the night before Friday, followed by a thaw. Chances of wet avalanches during the warm period. Windslabs could form at very high elevations, especially on easterly aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It will snow the night before Friday in rather light winds but rain at lower elevations, followed by a thaw at high elevations. Chaces of wet avalanches during the warm period. Freezing again on Friday afternoon. Windslabs could form at very high elevations, especially on easterly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lægð gengur yfir landið aðfaranótt föstudags með snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu á láglendi. Í kjölfarið hlánar hátt til fjalla um tíma en snýst svo í SV/V-átt og frystir. Úrkomulítið á laugardag og snýst í norðlægari átt með líkum á snjókomu á sunnudag.
